str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
Just as if, as it were. From hosper and ei; just as if, i.e. As it were.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a comparative of ek and titrosko; a miscarriage, i.e. untimely birth.
